skill.name: find-bugs
skill.description: Find bugs, security vulnerabilities, and code quality issues in local branch changes. Use when asked to review changes, find bugs, security review, or audit code on the current branch.
skill.summary: Find bugs, security vulnerabilities, and code quality issues in local branch changes. Use when asked...
skill.author: getsentry

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill containing only markdown instructions for AI-assisted code review. The static analyzer flagged 11 findings based on keyword matching out of context. All findings are false positives: 'Weak cryptographic algorithm' triggered on plain text describing user types and skill metadata; 'Hardcoded URL' triggered on source repository metadata; 'Ruby/shell backtick execution' triggered on git command documentation. No executable code, network calls, or file operations exist in this skill.

content.value_statement: Identify code issues in your changes. This skill systematically reviews branch changes for bugs, security vulnerabilities, and code quality problems using a structured approach.
actual_capabilities: Review git diff output for modified files
Map attack surface including inputs, queries, and auth checks
Check against OWASP security checklist (injection, XSS, auth, etc.)
Verify findings against existing code and tests
Prioritize security vulnerabilities over other issues
Provide severity levels and concrete fix suggestions
limitations: Does not execute code or run dynamic analysis
Cannot access production systems or real user data
Limited to changes visible in git diff of current branch
Does not modify code - only reports findings

output_examples.input: Find bugs in the changes on this branch
output: Critical - SQL Injection: api/users.js:42 - User input concatenated into SQL query without sanitization. Use parameterized queries.
High - Missing Authorization: api/admin.js:15 - Admin endpoint has no role check. Add authorization middleware.
Medium - Information Disclosure: utils/error.js:8 - Full stack trace logged in production. Log only error messages.
Low - Insecure Random: services/token.js:23 - Using Math.random() for tokens. Use crypto.randomBytes() instead.

output_examples.input: Check my recent changes for security issues
output: Critical - Command Injection: lib/builder.js:67 - User input passed to exec() without sanitization. Use allowlist validation.
High - Insecure Direct Object Reference: api/orders.js:23 - No ownership check on order retrieval. Add ownership verification.
High - Missing CSRF Protection: api/settings.js:15 - State-changing endpoint lacks CSRF token validation.

best_practices: Run this skill before every pull request to catch issues early
Combine with manual review for complex business logic
Use severity prioritization to focus on critical security issues first
anti_patterns: Using this skill as a replacement for understanding your own code
Ignoring findings without investigating the context
Running only on large diffs where output may be truncated

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The skill provides structured prompts for code review tasks.

faq.question: How thorough is the security check?
faq.answer: Covers OWASP Top 10 categories including injection, XSS, auth, and CSRF. Does not replace dynamic testing.

faq.question: Can I run this on the full codebase?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on branch changes. For full codebase scans, use dedicated static analysis tools.

faq.question: Is my code safe during review?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill that reads files through the AI assistant. No code leaves your environment.

faq.question: What if findings are false positives?
faq.answer: The skill includes a verification phase. Review the evidence and context before accepting any finding.

faq.question: How does this compare to SAST tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-assisted review with context awareness. Static analysis tools may catch different issues.
